net.proteusframework.internet.http.resource

Interface ResourceFactory

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ClassPathResourceFactory, CompositeResourceFactory, DynamicResourceFactory, ImageCaptchaResourceFactory

    public interface ResourceFactory
    A factory for creating resources that use a well known ID. The intent is to create resources that can be referenced across invocations of the ResourceManagerImpl. More efficient caching can be done with factory resources. Do not include caching in implementations of this class. To use a ResourceFactory implementation:
    1. Implement ResourceFactory
    2. Create an instance
    3. Register the instance using ResourceManagerImpl.register(ResourceFactory).
    4. Call ResourceManagerImpl.getResourceFromFactory(String, String) to get a resource instance OR use a medium dependent way to reference the resource.
    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      FactoryBasedResource createResource(String persistentResourceId)
      Creates a resource object from a persistent resource ID.
      String getFactoryId()
      Get the ID of the factory.

    • Method Detail

      • createResource

        @Nullable
FactoryBasedResource createResource(String persistentResourceId)
                                    throws SecurityException
        Creates a resource object from a persistent resource ID. The meaning of the ID depends on the factory implementation. The intent is that the ID depends on the source of the resource, such as a database. In that case the ID would be the unique identifier in the database.
        Parameters:
        persistentResourceId - the peristent resource ID.
        Returns:
        Resource or null if the resource cannot be created, for example if it does not exist.
        Throws:
        SecurityException - if access to the resource is not permitted. The code serving the content must catch this and handle appropriately, such as returning an HTTP 401 or 403 status code.

      • getFactoryId

        String getFactoryId()
        Get the ID of the factory. This ID is used to identify the factory and must be consistent across instances of the factory.
        Returns:
        String.
